content:
I got a following warning message when run lake update in https://github.com/Seasawher/SelectionSort.lean.

Warning: some files were not found in the cache.
This usually means that your local checkout of mathlib4 has diverged from upstream.
If you push your commits to a branch of the mathlib4 repository, CI will build the oleans and they will be available later.

And CI fails and CI log says same warning message.
How can I solve this problem?
this warning isnt displayed if I choose leanprover/lean4:v4.7.0 for this project.
Your lean toolchain needs to match the version of mathlib you're using exactly
I think Lean version and mathlib version match exactly...
how can I make two versions matched?
Check the lean toolchain file in mathlib at the commit you're using

@Ruben Van de Velde I got an error in CI.
I set mathlib version to s!"v{Lean.versionString}".
I think this make mathlib and Lean versions match...
Asei Inoue has marked this topic as resolved.
This issue was caused by lean-update-action. Thanks.
